history.content:
IIRC (and assuming nothing has changed), if there is anyone on the waitlist, then all students have to waitlist / can't directly enroll. Once the waitlist next processes (in a few hours?), you'll be let in. (This was to prevent people from sniping spots in full classes when someone drops and cutting the waitlist.)

You certainly meet the reserved seats restrictions described in http://classes.berkeley.edu/content/2018-spring-eleng-16a-001-lec-001.

IIRC (and assuming nothing has changed), if there is anyone on the waitlist, then all students have to waitlist / can't directly enroll. Once the waitlist next processes (in a few hours?), you'll be let in. (This was to prevent people from sniping spots in full classes when someone drops and cutting the waitlist.)
Please see the pinned enrollment restrictions and enroll in a back-up class that fulfills this requirement. Enrollment definitely isn't guaranteed.

Hi, I am a senior ChemE/MSE double major who needs to take EE16A to graduate (due to a complicated situation). I enrolled yesterday when there were only 40 people enrolled in the class, and it automatically put me on a waitlist. I am number 14 on the waitlist even though I believe I satisfy the non-EECS college of engineering student for which there are 66 reserved spots. Should the system automatically enroll such students, or is there a special process for this?

Thank you
history.subject: EE16A Waitlist
